description: {"blocks":[{"key":"1aqn9","text":"This protocol provides a detailed, step-by-step guide for conducting the Barnes maze test, a well-established behavioral assay for assessing spatial learning and memory in mice and rats. The maze utilizes a rodent's innate aversion to open, brightly lit spaces and their drive to seek a hidden, dark escape box. The procedure covers pre-experimental habituation, multi-day acquisition training trials to evaluate learning, and a final probe trial to assess long-term spatial memory retention. This method is a robust, dry-land alternative to the Morris water maze, minimizing stress associated with water immersion.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
ethics_statement: {"blocks":[{"key":"6eajv","text":"this protocol needs prior approval by the users' Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC) or equivalent ethics committee.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: ASAPCRN, barnes maze test, spatial memory retention, memory in mice, term spatial memory retention, maze, morris water maze, assessing spatial learning, barnes maze, land alternative to the morris water maze, barnes maze this protocol, spatial learning, mice, rodent, rat, behavioral assay, learning, innate aversion, memory, dark escape box, established behavioral assay

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.section: Setup
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9v9c8","text":"Have a clear open space in the middle of your behaviour room to work with. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Setup
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"e02to","text":"Tear napkin pieces into small squares to prepare for escape box covering","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Setup
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9b2p8","text":"Organize images (cross, triangle and circle) on the walls adjacent to maze apparatus. Ensure they are all at the same x and y plane.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Setup
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6l6s1","text":"Be sure to secure maze to ensure it does not shift during experiment","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Setup
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"89jls","text":"Obtain a cup that is wrapped in napkin or paper to allow for a dark enclosure for mice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Setup
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"c4q73","text":"*Allow for one hour period for mice in the testing room before each phase of the test each day.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2mhum","text":"*Cover home cages with trash bags or a blanket to keep it dark, leaving the front of the cage exposed to light.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: HABITUATION PHASE, Day 1 (no time limit, use home cage bedding):
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3dio8","text":"Check positioning of escape box on barnes maze apparatus and place home cage bedding inside.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: HABITUATION PHASE, Day 1 (no time limit, use home cage bedding):
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fi23c","text":"Place. Mouse in center of maze covered by dark cup.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: HABITUATION PHASE, Day 1 (no time limit, use home cage bedding):
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3u95q","text":"10 seconds after placement, allow mouse to freely roam the maze for an undefined amount of time until they find and independently enter the escape box.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: HABITUATION PHASE, Day 1 (no time limit, use home cage bedding):
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"453bo","text":"If mice do not find the escape box, gently guide mouse into the box and allow to sit in there for approx 2 min","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: HABITUATION PHASE, Day 1 (no time limit, use home cage bedding):
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8j6v1","text":"Upon entry, cover the escape box hole with a napkin for at least 15 seconds.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: HABITUATION PHASE, Day 1 (no time limit, use home cage bedding):
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3vkj0","text":"When removing, carefully and quietly remove the escape box with mouse from the apparatus and place the box in the cage to allow mouse to re-enter home cage.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: HABITUATION PHASE, Day 1 (no time limit, use home cage bedding):
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"e6thp","text":"Continue the above steps for each of your trials. Clean apparatus and box with 2% chlorohexadine disinfectant.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: ACQUISITION PHASE, Days 2-6 (5 days)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"72k4e","text":"After each trial in this phase: include clean, fresh bedding in the escape box to encourage entry into the tunnel, without them having to rely on a scent. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: ACQUISITION PHASE, Days 2-6 (5 days)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7i1pv","text":"For each trial, there will be one, 5-minute session: place mouse in center of apparatus covered by dark cup.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: ACQUISITION PHASE, Days 2-6 (5 days)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2g5j2","text":"If mouse does not find nor enter the escape box after 5 minutes, gently guide it towards the direction of the tunnel where they should enter on their own.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: ACQUISITION PHASE, Days 2-6 (5 days)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1m9q4","text":"Upon entry, cover the escape box hole with a napkin for at least 15 seconds.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: ACQUISITION PHASE, Days 2-6 (5 days)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"432jv","text":"Carefully remove escape box from maze apparatus and gently place in the home cage of the mouse to allow it to re-enter cage.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: ACQUISITION PHASE, Days 2-6 (5 days)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"691s3","text":"Continue the above steps for each of your trials. Clean apparatus and box with 2% chlorohexadine disinfectant.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: PROBE TRIAL, Day 9 (1 day, after two rest/off days)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"28q64","text":"Ensure maze is in position so that the holes are in the same position as during the training/acquisition days. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: PROBE TRIAL, Day 9 (1 day, after two rest/off days)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2hjbh","text":"Remove escape hole from apparatus for the duration of the trials.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: PROBE TRIAL, Day 9 (1 day, after two rest/off days)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9vd51","text":"For each trial, there will be one, 90second session: Place mouse in center of apparatus and allow to roam for duration of session.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: PROBE TRIAL, Day 9 (1 day, after two rest/off days)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"a9t7t","text":"Return mouse to home cage.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: PROBE TRIAL, Day 9 (1 day, after two rest/off days)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ab9ve","text":"Continue the above steps for each of your trials. Clean apparatus and box with 2% chlorohexadine disinfectant.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Barnes Maze
